      • writeBaseToNearestNeighborStepFrequencyMapToFile

        public static boolean writeBaseToNearestNeighborStepFrequencyMapToFile(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String>>> aBaseToNearestNeighborStepFrequencyMap,
                                                                       java.lang.String aDestinationFilePathname)
        Writes aBaseToNearestNeighborStepFrequencyMap to file. NOTE: Bases and nearest neighbors are sorted ascending in file. NOTE: If destination pathname already exists nothing is done.
        Parameters:
        aBaseToNearestNeighborStepFrequencyMap - Base to nearest-neighbor step-frequency map (may be null then false is returned)
        aDestinationFilePathname - Full pathname of destination (may be null then false is returned)
        Returns:
        true: Operation was successful, false: Operation failed

        Returns:

      • add_b_to_a

        public static void add_b_to_a(double[] a_x,
                              double[] a_y,
                              double[] a_z,
                              double[] b_x,
                              double[] b_y,
                              double[] b_z)
        Adds b to a NOTE: NO checks are performed.
        Parameters:
        a_x - x-component of a (may be changed)
        a_y - y-component of a (may be changed)
        a_z - z-component of a (may be changed)
        b_x - x-component of b (is not changed)
        b_y - y-component of b (is not changed)
        b_z - z-component of b (is not changed)

                                                    double[] aR_x,

                                                    double[] aRold_x,
                                                    double[] aRold_y,
                                                    double[] aRold_z)

        Parameters:
        aCurrentTimeStep - Current time step
        aMoleculeFixationInfos - Molecule fixation infos
        aR_x - Current x-position of particle in simulation box (may be changed)
        aR_y - Current y-position of particle in simulation box (may be changed)
        aR_z - Current z-position of particle in simulation box (may be changed)
        aRold_x - Old x-position of particle in simulation box (is NOT changed)
        aRold_y - Old y-position of particle in simulation box (is NOT changed)
        aRold_z - Old z-position of particle in simulation box (is NOT changed)

        aF_y - Current y-components of particle forces
        aF_z - Current z-components of particle forces
        aDpdMasses - DPD masses of particles
        aTimeStepLengthHalf - Half of time step length
        anIsDpdUnitMass - Flag for use of DPD unit masses. True : DPD masses of all particles are set to 1, False: ...

      • calculateMinMeanMax

        public static double[] calculateMinMeanMax(double[] aX,
                                           double[] aY,
                                           double[] aZ)
        Calculates min, mean and max magnitude of vector components if magnitude is not zero NOTE: No checks are performed.
        Parameters:
        aX - x-component of vector
        aY - y-component of vector
        aZ - z-component of vector
        Returns:
        Array of length 3 with min (index 0), mean (index 1) and max (index 2) magnitude of (non-zero magnitude) vector components

      • scale_v

        public static double scale_v(double[] aV_x,
                             double[] aV_y,
                             double[] aV_z,
                             double[] aDpdMasses,
                             double aTemperature,
                             boolean anIsDpdUnitMass)
        Scales v NOTE: No checks are performed.
        Parameters:
        aV_x - Current x-components of particle velocities (may be changed)
        aV_y - Current y-components of particle velocities (may be changed)
        aV_z - Current z-components of particle velocities (may be changed)
        aDpdMasses - DPD masses of particles
        aTemperature - Temperature in DPD units (i.e. kT fractions, k: Boltzmann constant)
        anIsDpdUnitMass - Flag for use of DPD unit masses. True : DPD masses of all particles are set to 1, False: ...
        Returns:
        Velocity scale factor
